Aug 15 2009 	Perfect location	The Homewood Suites were a perfect central spot for exploring all the Chicago highlights. We were close by to shopping, the theatre, and plenty of good restaurants. Aug 14 2009 	Great place to stay convenient to many attractions	We arrived too early to check in, but staff secured our luggage and we started discovering Chicago and came back at 4pm and had no problem checking in. Jul 26 2009 	great value for the location	You can be in the heart of downtown Chicago, with a suite and continental breakfast for a little over a hundred dollars. I was completely satisfied.

Jul 23 2009 	Awesome! Great Location friendly service! Huge rooms	Been to Chicago about 5 times so far... & by far the Homewood Suites was our favorite hotel we have stayed. Jul 22 2009 	Another fantastic stay	Stayed, for the second time, the last week in June and till 4th July. Jul 21 2009 	Another great stay	This is my 4th time at this hotel, and once again it was a great stay. This time I brought some family members who had their own room. Breakfast is crowded on the weekends, but having to wait for the host to seat you is a nice touch - no one takes your table and it seems more like a restaurant. This time we had a huge room, but it was very oddly shaped. Get a corner room if you can, they are small, but have 2 windows in the living area. Jul 14 2009 	Hidden Gem	We had a great experience from the moment we pulled up in front of the hotel. The valet/bellhops are so friendly. Check-in was a breeze. The hotel was packed but they did a great job of getting people in and out. We never waited more than 5 minutes to get a table. The pool was clean and warm and our kids spent a lot of time in it. Everytime we had to go somewhere and didn't want to talk, we just went to the front desk and the girls would tell us exactly which buses to take. We will definately stay here again.

Jul 13 2009 	Home away from home	My wife and I stayed here for over two weeks in January. I have never felt so cold outside and so warm inside. The location is within walking distance of many good restaurants and the Magnificent Mile for shopping. We plan to go back next year.

Jul 12 2009 	Central to everything!	The Homewood Suites Chicago was a new find for us on our annual siblings reunion weekend. The hotel was running a weekend rate special in May, and it looked nice in photos, so we took a chance. The hotel is in the River North section, and parking is expensive - $34-42 a day, depending on whether you choose garage or valet service. But, the location is worth it, it's a block from the Loop train (underground at State and Grand). And, you can walk everywhere in Chicago from this hotel, which is nice on a wonderful summer weekend.The suite is arranged with a kitcen, dining table for 2, a sleeper sofa and chair is one room, and a king size bed and the bath in the other room. The bathroom sink is separate from the toilet and shower, which is convenient. The kitchen has a dishwasher, serveware, coffee maker and toaster, plus a microwave and a 2 burner stove. And it has granite countertops, a nice touch. This hotel is thrilling all of the little ones, and fitness freaks. The 19th floor has a very nice pool,, 4 feet deep and long enough to do some laps. I have never seen so many well-behaved children under constant parental supervision in a hotel before, which I loved (thanks to parents who understand it's important to watch your kids at all times). There are lots of towels and tables and chairs for parents to relax, looking out over the city to the west. The fitness center has nice free weights, heavy balls and treadmills. If you prefer, there is a complimentaty pass to the health club Crunch next door.The full breakfast is a full breakfast - sausage and biscuits, corned beef, bacon, scrambled eggs, pastries, french toast, cereals, yogurt and cottage cheese, fresh fruit, toasted breads, coffee, tea, juices. They serve the breakfast in a dining hall that is crowded at peak times, so you can pack a box from the breakfast buffet and take it back to your room. No dinky cups, either...everything is full sized, and they keep replenishing the buffet until closing time. Outside the hotel, Nordstroms across the street has great sales, and you can walk inside through a mall to get to Michigan Avenue 2 blocks to the east - convenient on a rainy day. Restaurants in the area offer every kind of food. We tried Shaw's Crab House and Rockit and were very pleased. Be sure to try Ina's on W. Randolph for breakfast, too.Also not to miss in the area are Millennium Park - what a fun place for kids - and the beaches along Lake Michigan. We tried a street fair to the north and had a nice walk after having lunch there. Last but not least, the wireless access to the internet. It's free, and there's a router in each room above the kitchen cabinets. We had to reboot the router each time we signed on - unplug the power for a few seconds, then reconnect it. It worked each time we tried that.

Jul 3 2009 	Great location!	This was the first of two hotels we stayed at during the week during NPE Week. Overall, the three day stay was very good. Room was large, very clean, bed very comfortable, free internet, clean kitchen and kids enjoyed the pool and breakfast was a huge convenience. We tried to switch our room from a default king reservation to a double, but the front desk wasn't too responsive about our request. They offered a roll a way bed, but we used the sofa bed for the kids instead. I would have preferred they rectify the situation, but I let it slide. Workout room is very nice, but it was 80+ degrees. They also offer a free pass to Crunch Gym next door. Great location! 24 hour business center was a great feature too! I was able to use the facility to print discount tickets to an attraction. Loved this!

Jun 22 2009 	Just another YES vote	Not much to add to what others have already stated - it's a terrific hotel. Breakfast was complimentary and was more than adequate for our family to start our day. Sure it was not the $20 a head buffet at the Hilton, but nobody walked away hungry. The Homewood Suites is going to be our choice in downtown chicago with that kind of service ! ALso the price was right,too. We paid $139.00 for a King Suite. May 23 2009 	Great Time	I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Homewood Suites Downtown. The breakfast is good. The free buffet breakfast had scrambled eggs, meats, cereal, make your own waffles, etc. There is also a dinner with a different menu Mon-Thurs but I did not have that. There is a gym inhouse, but you can use the Crunch gym next door (same building) that is much bigger and has everything. The entrance is not much to look at; just an elevator to the sixth floor where reception is. But the bellman was friendly and the reception desk was efficient and very friendly. It does cost a lot to park here (I think $42/night so don't bring a car). There is a small store next to reception, open 24/7. Free wired and wireless internet in the room. Only minor complaint is that the walls are somewhat thin so if the neighbor raises his voice I can hear it. Also, I can hear water running next door. But all in all I would definitely stay here again. It's much more comfortable and better value than the big hotels nearby.
May 16 2009 	best feeling	Just a really nice place, great service, big rooms, excellent value, everyone seemed to be having a good time , loved the buffet meals,

May 15 2009 	Absoulte Gem!	What a great hotel! We stayed here for a week and had a wonderful time. The room was homely with an enormous bed, just the ticket after a days sight seeing. Homewoods was just a few minutes walk of the Mag Mile which makes this hotel a great base when visiting Chicago. I would definately stay here again in the future!

May 7 2009 	A Great Place To Stay	Our Amtrak train was very late and Amtrak put us up in the Homewood Suites for the nite. A very nice hotel and the staff were super nice. And the free breakfast was super as well.

Apr 24 2009 	Super location with great facilities	My husband and I stayed here to celebrate a wedding anniversary and found these suites a fantastic place to stay. Apr 20 2009 	Great Family Hotel and Super Location!	My kids, ages 10 and 7, are still raving about the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! Apr 17 2009 	Great place if you are taking the kids.	This is such a great hotel if you are taking a family vacation. My husband was ecstatic to find beer on tap. (Note that this is only offered Mon. - Thur.) The location is wonderful. We walked to the American Girl Doll store and also Garrets Popcorn which we highly recommend. Staff was always pleasant and helpful. The pool was great as it was only 4'6" in the deep end so we were able to let the kids swim while we sat and watched. The rooms are clean and spacious but I would never call them romantic or extravent. We had a king bed and the kids slept on the sofa sleeper in the main room. Perfect. If returning on a couples weekend, I'd try for a different style hotel but this was an awesome family vacation. The kids had a blast. Directly across the street is a mall with a Legos store.( didn't find it until the last night or the kids would have dragged us there everyday.) Also near the ESPN Zone restaurant and game room. Apr 7 2009	Great place for a family trip	My husband, mother, sister-in-law, and I visited this hotel for a weekend trip to Chicago. Checkin was easy. I don't use credit cards, and wanted to check in with my check card. I was able to pay the hotel stay in full at checkin, so I didn't have a hold placed on my ard for incindentals- NICE!The hotel is situated about two blocks away from the Magnificent Mile. We had a room on the top floor, with a great view of the city. When walking into the room, we noticed that the entire far wall of the hotel room consisted of windows, so the view was breathtaking. The kitchen was by the door, then a desk/workstation, and then the living room with a sleeper sofa and flat-screen tv. The bedroom was to the left, and had two double beds. High speed internet was free, and the business center (free) was nice too for printing out our flight boarding passes. Bathroom was in the actual bedroom, and the sink/vanity was outside the bathroom. The water pressure in the shower was great, and the neutrogena toiletries provided were nice. The only things I wish were different were the poor venthilation in the bathroom, and the pretty thin mattress on the pullout sofa. If you're planning to sleep on it, please bring a mattress pad. The pool area seemed nice- we never swam in the pool since children always seemed to be in there, even late in the evening. The exercise room was small but nice- again, one whole wall consisted of windows, so you have a great view while working out. Complimentary breakfast is great. Please get there early if you are here on the weekends. The wait will be about 5-10 minutes otherwise. Eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, cereals, bagels, yogurt, and fresh fruit are always served. One day we had french toast, another we had biscuits. The coffee and fruit juices are great. The staff is wonderful. We had one on the staff members give us tips on great places to eat in the area, and he actually pulled out a map and showed us where each restaurant was. He spoke with us for about 10 minutes about what to see and where to eat, I thought that was so nice. Overall, if you are planning a trip with family members and want a great place to stay, I strongly recommend you consider this hotel. If you are looking for a romantic place for just the two of you, you may want to stay elsewhere.

Mar 27 2009 	Made our experience in Chicago wonderful!	The front desk staff, bellman and valet staff were wonderful! They totally made us feel welcome and at home. It was within walking distance of Rainforest Cafe, Ed Debevics, Hard Rock Cafe & Water Tower Place. We were constantly asking staff questions and they always went above and beyond with their answers. Mar 23 2009 	Great choice with kids	We stayed here for 4 nights recently and had a fantastic trip. Jan 31 2009 	Awesome location. Very good value.	I stayed at this Hotel for 1 night. We just wanted to stay in downtown Chicago. This hotel is right next to John Hancock building. Jan 28 2009 	It's all in the details... Jan 22 2009 	All We Wanted	Free breakfast buffet and free light dinner, great location, capable friendly staff, cheapest rates.

Jan 11 2009 	A great hotel!	We recently stayed 3 nights at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago and wow, were we impressed! This is a great value for a downtown Chicago hotel. The location is wonderful. We walked everywhere from the Magnificent Mile, to the Navy Pier, to Millenium and Grant Park, to the Field Museum of Natural History (that was a pretty good hike though!) The downtown trolley stop is right around the corner, and we also got a cab easily one night. There are tons of restaurants nearby. The original deep dish pizza place, Pizzeria Uno, is on one corner , the ESPN Sports Zone restaurant is on another, and the Weber Grill restaurant around the block, to name a few. There was also a good brewery nearby for drinks. The suite was quite spacious with a full kitchen and a large bathroom. There was a TV in both the sitting area and the bedroom. We were on the 19th floor at the end of the hall and never heard anyone else, so it was quite restful. The building has one of the fastest elevators I've ever ridden on! There is a heated pool (no hot tub!) and small fitness room on the 19th floor, and guests can also use a fitness club that is next door. We went to the fitness club one of the days we were there and enjoyed the expanded equipment they had. Our room had complimentary wireless, and we had no problems with the internet connection. The complimentary breakfast was typical of the hot breakfast buffets with eggs, meat, waffles, fruit, etc., but I thought there were a few touches that made it above the standard. The fruit was all fresh, including fresh pineapple, and there were real dishes and silverware, not plastic. There were two attendants who kept everything stocked and cleared our tables. The dining area was large and comfortable. We were there for one night of the Manager's Special (weeknights, 5 - 7pm) and were shocked at how much food was served. It was really enough for a meal, not the light snacks we expected. We noticed several people doing carryouts to eat in their room, which was easy to do with the full kitchen and refrigerator. We had friendly and polite service from everyone we encountered the entire time, from the valets, to the front desk, to the dining area attendants, and cleaning staff. It seemed like there were just a lot of special touches, like bowls of snacks sitting out when we checked in (tired and hungry) and the complimentary daily newspaper. We got the suite for $119, which was an amazing value for downtown Chicago and the amenities it had. The only downside that others have commented on is the parking costs ($38). However, it was pretty comparable to the costs for parking at other downtown hotels, and it was nice to know that our car was safe in a covered lot. Overall, this was a great hotel experience and good value, and I would highly recommend it to anyone, especially families who need more space and can cut food costs with the complimentary breakfast and Manager's Special.

Jan 10 2009 	Good Value	I really enjoyed every interaction with the staff at the Homewood but unfortunately the room that we stayed in was in urgent need of an update. The Homewood is located very close to Michigan Ave and is surrounded by wonderful restaurants. It is a great choice for a first time visitor to Chicago.

Jan 8 2009 	Nice hotel - Great location	This hotel more than met our expectations. It is in a nice spot just a couple blocks east of Michigan Avenue. Jan 2 2009 	Good Stay for this Downtown Hotel	This hotel is located very nicely in the heart of Chicago downtown.Located one block east of Michigan Ave.There are actually 4 Hilton Properties within 3 blocks of this hotel(Conrad, Embassy Suites & Hilton Garden Inn)Upon getting to the hotel we were met by the Bellman who assured once we got checked in that our bags would be brought to our room.We were able to check in early (10AM) On New Years Eve and were originally given a room on the 19th floor.However, upon getting to the 19th floor we tried getting into the room and the key wouldn't work.We went back to the front desk and found out that someone was in this room still. (Oops.)Then we were given a room on the 18th floor (Room 1811) Nice 1 bedroom suite with a full kitchen (which would be useful when the family was here or if staying for long periods of time)Room was comfortable and all was in working order.Internet access was a little slow at times, but all in all very comfortable.The hotel is located one block from Michigan Ave, 5 blocks from the Navy Pier and across the street from Shops at Northbridge.If you want to see famous people and sports figures (I would suggest Joes Stone Crab. (Located right on the corner of the hotel)We saw the Coach of the Bulls, Rex Grossman, Brian Urlachers, Jonathan Toews & Coach of the Bears there during our New Year's Dinner.Oprah and Barbara Striesand had been there two nights previous.The hotel is located one short block from the (Grand Red Line Subway)An enjoyable experience and would return again.

Dec 15 2008 	Not bad...	The location is excellent, next to Northbridge Mall and a block from Michigan Avenue. Nov 30 2008 	Good Value for near Mich Ave	We stayed here Thanksgiving night since we were joining family at Lawry's two blocks away for Thanksgiving dinner. There was a single sink across from the closet and the toilet/bath in a separate room. The waffle maker had the longest line so that held up the meal. Everything else was being constantly refilled. Overall it was a step up from Hampton but not as good as Embassy Suites. One of the ladies who was with us had a manicure there and was quite pleased with it.You enter the hotel at the Grand Avenue entrance (there is a valet there) and take the elevator to the 6th floor lobby to check in. The valet personnel and staff at the lobby desk were friendly and professional. Parking is a bit steep: $38/night, but you are in the heart of downtown Chicago.....There is a rooftop pool which we didn't have time to use because we were so busy doing other things, but if you have your heart on soaking in a hot tub, this will not be the place for you....Breakfast both mornings we were there was quite ample: scrambled eggs, sausage, french toast, bagels and muffins, juice, coffee, biscuits and gravy--lots of choices and all good. Also loved the hot water/coffee station in the lobby with decaf and regular coffee and lots of teas plus hot chocolate packets to make your own and carry to your room!Make sure you head down to Ghirardelli's Chocolate Store where you can get coffee/hot chocolate drinks, of course their signature chocolate candies and even ice cream sundaes and other dessert treats to die for. We also took a horse and carriage ride (35 minutes) around Lakeshore drive and the general downtown area. It was a bit chilly when we went, but we had our Ghirardelli hot beverages, plus the carriage had blankets to put on our laps. Filene's basement, home of great bargains, is next door to Ghirardelli's as is a Borders Book Store. Ate dinner one night at the Grand Lux Cafe. Very, very good. It's owned by the same company that does The Cheesecake Factory. I had a peach bellini to drink and chicken lettuce wraps which was a large portion and I couldn't even finish....desserts are amazing: try the chocolate molten cake or the warm rustic apple pie. Lots of dessert choices--go on their website and check it out. They don't take reservations, so if you go for dinner, try and get there about 4:30. We had a 15 minute wait on a Saturday night and were glad we got in. During our dinner, the lobby area swelled with people waiting for a table...If you get there later than 5:00 pm, expect to wait at least 45 minutes to an hour. Hotel rooms have a nice kitchen area/dining room table--a bit on the small side, but we were on the 11th floor and had a corner room with nice views of the downtown area. Living area had a sofa that turned into a bed. Two of us shared the king-sized bed, and then we ordered a roll-away for the extra person in our party. Nice flat screen tv in the livingroom.....room wasn't ready when our party arrived and check-in staff gave us a bottle of wine to compensate for the wait. Everything was clean and having a refrigerator and all of the usual kitchen utensils (especially wine glasses!) and stove/microwave came in handy when we wanted to heat something up or store it for the next day in the fridge.I would definitely stay here again--it was a bit pricey--aside from the parking, we paid about $280 for our room, but this was a girl's weekend and was a splurge for us. Next time, I will bring my husband and two teenagers here!

Sep 27 2008 	Nice Place to Stay with Kids	We stayed at this hotel using Hilton Honors points for four nights in a 15th floor non-smoking king suite. We always like the extra space of a suite when traveling with our two children, ages 8 and 6.Pros: The location of this hotel was great for our travel purposes - it was an easy walk to the Navy Pier, up Mag. Mile, to American Girl Place, to the Hancock building and to Gino's East pizza. There is a Nordstrom right across the street from the hotel. We did take a cab to the Field Museum and Art Institute. The suite was clean, beds comfortable, and the carpeting new. The decor was nice. We had a fantastic view of the Hancock building from our room. We appreciated the large fridge. The breakfast (included with the room) was very good - much better than others we've had at other Homewood Suites. The indoor pool was recently refurbished and sparkling clean. The pool is located on the 19th floor (top floor) of the hotel and the city views are amazing - a unique swimming experience! We had the pool all to ourselves, but it is small and could get crowded... Cons: Housekeeping! Our room was not made up until after 4:00 p.m. each day, and we had to call and ask for housekeeping each day. Very annoying! Our other con for this hotel is that there is just a small single sink/vanity area in the bathroom - we prefer the double sinks at Embassy Suites. It could get a little crowded each morning as we all tried to get ready for the day. Also, there is no hot tub in the pool area - that would have been nice to relax in after all of the walking around we did each day.No hotel is perfect, and despite the cons, we would consider this hotel again for a future Chicago stay.

Sep 24 2008 	Its the wonderful staff	Great location,good rooms excellent breakfast(really good choice)pleasant lobby area(Free coffee,juice and fruit for guests)and free use of internet in executive suite)but it,s the staff that most impresses.The guys at the entrace,the dining room wait staff ,the cleaners to reception(Jennifer in particular)all made you feel at home with nothing too much trouble for them.If you want a home away from home then this is the place for you.This is customer care as it should be

Sep 4 2008 	So many positives but need redecoration	We stayed midweek for 3 nights - 2 Adults & 2 children. Aug 27 2008	Wonderful Chicao Hotel	This hotel has an excellent location for walking Chicago's downtown, pier, etc.Mon-Thurs. they offered a wonderful early evening free light dining.Our room had a separate bedroom, extremely clean and quiet.The breakfast was outstanding.

Aug 23 2008 	Great Time Great Location would come back to Homewood Suites	I read all the reviews for this and other hotels and once i made my selection i was very pleased to see that all the reviewers were right on about tis hotel. Aug 2 2008 	Great hotel. Good location.	This is a nice hotel in an excellent location. Everywhere is easy to get to, Michigan Ave is about 5 mins walk. Jul 25 2008 	Good Stay Great Location Good Price	We spent 4 nights at the Homewood Suites in early July. We did help ourselves to beer and wine, which we brough back to our room for an early evening break.-Location - A fairly quiet street, only 1 block from Mag Mile, and right in between Rush and Wabash. Jul 23 2008 	Nice Place To Stay In A Hectic City	I found the hotel to be a nice positive surprise. Internet access is free, breakfast is free, cocktails and soft drinks are free in the early evening just as it is at Embassy Suites, but this hotel offers free dinner. While I was there for two nights we were offered fish night and China buffet night. The food is what one would expect at a buffet style offering. I was there to attend a trade show at the McCormick Place Convention Center which is about a $10-$12 cab ride at this writing. I would stay at this hotel again if in the area again.

Jul 21 2008 	Recommend This Hotel	We enjoyed this hotel for our recent vacation to Chicago. Unfortunately, we never got to use this, but it would have been fun if we had had more time. The exercise room and pool were pretty nice. Jul 7 2008 	Fantastic location!	Location....location....location! The Homewood is the best hotel to stay in Chicago. It is a suite style hotel so we had a kitchen, living room and bedroom. Jul 5 2008 	Location Location Location	We spent 3 nights at the Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago. When we arrived our room wasn't ready. Jun 28 2008 	Very good if suite's are your thing.	This is not a well-known hotel in Chicago, but it's really interesting.The location is ideal for just about any purpose: just off the magnificent mile, a blockfrom the red line subway and a few blocks from the El.The hotel is not super-noticeable from the street; the entrance ison street level but the hotel lobby is 6 floors up on theelevator.The rooms are not just suites, they're really large suites -- witha well-equipped kitchen, a living area with sofa and bath, and a bedroomwith full private bath. They have nice views of the city andare well-equipt (big screen tv in the living room, largetv in the bedroom).One thing that's a bit strange about the place in thisage of niche-marketing is thatit caters both to budget-conscious tourists with large familiesand to business travelers on long-term stays who are usingsomebody else's money.So on the one hand they have wifi and internet in the rooms,and an enthusiastic full-service business-savvy front desk; on the other hand, theyhave a mini-market that has basic cooking staples, and theyhave a *coin laundry* (try finding that in a Marriott Courtyard!).During my stay, they managed to cater to both groupsquite well.My only minor complaint was about breakfast --yeah it's complimentary, and they have a lot of staff on handto try to make it run smoothly. Jun 25 2008 	Two thumbs up to Homewood Suites	My wife and I returned home today from Chicago. We stayed at the Homewood Suites for five days. The service was amazing. We were a little early arriving so the door man stored our luggage until it was time for us to check in. The door men were very helpful. They informed us of great restaurants and the best way to get where we were going. The breakfast was good. We had some problems with one of the hostess on one morning. She was a little unfriendly. Other than that all was well. There was plenty of food to choose from and it was decent quality.Wasn't into the Manager reception. We always had plans so it was not an option for us. We walked by one night and there was several people taking advantage of the free meal. The room was nice. We had a great view looking South. We were on the 17th floor. From our room we could see the Sears Tower, United Center, and Trump Tower to name a few. I got to see a lot of construction going on over at the trump tower. The Trump Tower is one of the coolest buildings I have ever seen. Having a kithchenette was awesome. We had a pizza from Giordanno's delivered the first night. We ate half and put the rest in the fridge for the next day. So on the third day, we had a pizza from Gino's East delivered and did the same. By the way, we thought that Giordanno's was the better of the two. For the most part, everyone was friendly at the HWS. It really made our stay enjoyable.

Jun 18 2008 	magnificent stay near Magnificent Mile	Homewood Suites has got it all: great location for restaurants, shopping and attractions,comfortable suites,free breakfasts and internet,friendly staff,etc. A super place to stay in Chicago.

Jun 16 2008 	excellent downtown hotel	This is one of my favorite downtown Chicago hotels in its price range (~ $200/night on the weekend). PROS:* The rooms really are suites (with a door you can close to separate the bedroom from the living area).* The living area has an HDTV, with hookups for laptops if you're hosting a small business meeting in your room.* There's a nice kitchenette complete with stove, fridge & sink (great if traveling with kids)* The free breakfast buffet was excellent. * All of the staff members we encountered were very friendly and helpful.CONS:* The only negative thing I can say isn't really even a big deal at all, but I'll note it anyway... even though the room comes with an HDTV, there's no HDTV content. For example, instead of ESPN HD, you get standard-def ESPN stretched to fit the bigger screen.

Jun 15 2008 	Excellent accommodations very friendly staff!	We stayed for 4 nights Tuesday through Friday and we loved absolutely everything about our time here. The hotel is in a superb location, less than a minutes walk to the subway and only a few minutes walk to the magnificent mile. The hotel offers free breakfast everyday and free dinner Monday through Thursday. The hotel staff is very friendly and polite and its nice to see a place where everyone is willing to help out. They had a security guard deliver extra towels to our room. The fact that security is willing to help out guests really says alot about this place. Overall I highly recommend this hotel to all who are traveling to Chicago. You wont be disappointed with your stay.

Jun 12 2008 	Highly recommended	The location of this hotel was excellent as it is just beside the subway and the bus stop for the free trolley bus to Navy Pier is just beside the hotel. The room was very spacious. Kind of too big for a solo traveler. The view from the room was excellent and it was a great view to sleep at night. The bathroom was spacious too and the room has a big wardrobe.The kitchen has microwave oven and cooking utensils. Some of the cooking utensils were a bit dirty, probably because they had not been used for sometime. However, the microwave oven was very useful as I can heat up food to eat at night.You can easily walk to the magnificent mile by cutting across the shopping mall across the road. Do check out Pizzeria Uno which is near the hotel that serves the delicious deep dish pizza. For cheaper food, do check out the foodcourt at the shopping mall.The hotel also serves breakfast and dinner from Mon to Thur. I did not find the food that fantastic but it was pretty decent.I will strongly recommend this hotel to everyone going to Chicago.

Jun 10 2008 	Great All Suite Hotel	We stayed at Homewood Suites for one week in May. It was a very nice all suite hotel with so many amenities. Weather was cool and rainy (2 half days only), but thats a given for the month of May. Ive attached pictures (not of hotel, as they are exactly as is on the website).We were very close to everything (red line CTA, shopping on Michigan Avenue, restaurants, convenience stores, bus stops, free shuttle to Navy Pier just a few steps away) etc. The best location we could have chosen.Room was relatively clean. Flat screen in living room was either damaged or had bad resolution, few other minor issues. Rooms were cleaned every day around 10-11am, everything was replenished. I agree with others on this forum that the rooms do look a lot larger on the website than in reality; which is small, but again, comfortable surroundings. Not much walking space in the bedroom and I banged into the wall in the middle of the night on my way to the washroom, so be careful lol. Our room was quite which we were grateful for. Every vacation weve been on, weve had noisy occupants, so this was a first.Breakfast buffet had a large variety of choices to suit everyone. We did not care for the liquid scrambled cheese eggs (too dry and rubbery) and bacon, but everything else was great. We had malt waffles every day! Biscuits are hot and tender. Fresh whole fruit or cut up fruit is a plus, as is skim milk and yogurt. I would personally suggest trying the great restaurants that Chicago has to offer rather than the free dinner buffet (Mon-Thursday), but if youre on a budget or have a large family to feed, etc. you might want to give it a try. There is free red/white wine and beer, and we saw many people come down for just that.Free internet access with color printer in the business center was a real plus for helping us research and print off maps for our itinerary. Printer wasnt working on the last two days we were there though. Gym and pool on 19th floor with a great night view. We never made use of it, but wish we had the time. Some highlights of our trip were the deep dish pizza which we could not get enough of, the Lincoln Zoo, shopping on Michigan Avenue and The Blue Man Group, which we saw at the last minute. I got pulled onstage by one of the Blue men and it was a thrill to be part of the show for about 15 minutes!! We love Chicago and will definitely return. We will definitely stay at Homewood Suites! Please message me if you require further info on anything at all. We had a fabulous time. Other than our AA flight which was cancelled and delayed by 12 hours, it was a nice vacation!

Jun 9 2008 	A pleasant surprise	My friends and I were celebrating a Bachelorette party downtown and all pitched in on a room at the Homewood Suites because of its great location and the price was reasonable as well. The suite was spacious. We had a nice sized kitchen (glasses, coffee mugs, silverware, plates, etc). Late at night, we called down to room service for extra blankets and pillows. They brought them to our room within 5 minutes...that really impressed me. Also, the king size bed was very comfortable.The overall pros:-plenty of space-comfortable bed with goose down pillows-huge flat screen tv in the "living room" area-well stocked kitchen area-very clean-room service was quickThe cons:-remote for the tv in the bedroom didn't work-electrical outlet next to vanity didn't work-pull-out couch was uncomfortable to sleep on-lcheck in is not on the first level of the hotel-parking is pricey!

Jun 1 2008 	Ideal for Chicago	This is an excellent option for downtown Chicago. Spacious suites, 2 TV's one a HD, huge double bed, decent kitchenette; All at a v reasonable price.Staff are v friendly and the location just off the Mag Mile is ideal. Red Line subway (Grand) outside the hotel is perfect for White Sox stadium....2 mins from a Jewel Osco supermarket and tons of bars and restaurants including the brilliant Pops for Champagne.Highly recommened.

May 30 2008 	A Great Place to Stay!	We stayed at the Homewood Suites for 3 nights in November 2007. (My partner & 10 month Son). This was a great place to stay with a family, the location was amazing and the service at the hotel was wonderful with some of the most friendly staff I have ever experienced. May 25 2008 	A great experience	We just got home from our 4 day stay at the Homewood Suites. I have been to Chicago several times before, but this was my first time staying in the Homewood Suites. The homewood suites was nicer and more affordable than hotels I have stayed in previously.My family and I were really impressed with the Homewood Suites. We had a 1 bedroom King suite. As mentioned before there was a full sized fridge and freezer, with a really fast ice maker, a dishwasher, and dishes including pots and pans. I really liked that there was door to shut the bedroom off from the living room. Hot scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, corned beef hash, fresh fruit in addition to typical cold breakfast options like bagels, donuts, muffins, cereal and yogurt. I have to say being able to start our day with a hot breakfast each day was great.The staff was friendly, especially the doormen and valet parkers. We mentioned where we were going one day and they gave us directions to the closest place to get a CTA pass and then told us which bus we would need. May 23 2008 	Good	It was just OK. Very clean. Polite staff. Quiet. Great Location. Rooms are smaller than they look on the hotel web-site Breakfast was a rip-off, take a short walk to the pancake house. Teeny tiny beds, something between a full and a twin, tight for 2 people to sleep in. We have 3 10 year-olds and needed a suite with room. The couch folds out - fine for kids. $10 per day for internet access... another rip-off. I would stay here again but look at other options first.

May 17 2008 	At home at the Homewood Suites	My stay was 5 days and I was there for a convention. All the staff, from the bellmen to the front desk were friendly and helpful. The breakfast and managers dinner receptions had quite a variety and was always good. The hotel location was great-just one block off Michigan avenue with plenty of restaurants around to choose from, There were two groceries nearby-Jewel Osco and Trader Joes-that I bought wraps & sandwiches to pack for lunch at the convention. (The food situation at McCormick Place Convention Center was awful-but that is another story!) There was plenty of shopping and I never felt unsafe walking alone. The room was nice but the carpet was frayed at the bathroom entrance and I did wonder if the carpets were ever vacuumed as I noticed a cookie crumb I had dropped stayed there almost the whole stay. But still basically a nice room with a nice view-especially at night. My price per night fluctuated from @189.00 to start, up to 312.00 by the end of my stay-of course I would have liked to have the cheaper price the whole stay. I would stay here again (if the price was right) and would recommend it.

May 12 2008 	Friendly staff great location great value	My husband and I stayed for four nights at the Homewood Suites in Chicago and would highly recommend it. I'll try not to repeat other reviewers, but it must be said again that the location of the hotel is very desirable. It's one block off the red line for the subway and many sights are within walking distance of the hotel. As others have said the morning breakfast is a huge value and it's quite good. I liked that they put out to-go containers and were happy to allow people to take food back to their room. We could only take advantage of the evening snacks and drinks one night as they're only offered Monday - Thursday evenings. Our experience was the food was pretty bland, but it was great to have a few free glasses of wine. The pool on the top floor is great as you can look out the windows and see all the Downtown lights and buildings while you're in the pool. There's a small work out facility as well. The room itself was very comfortable and immaculate. I liked that you could easily get food delivered to your room from nearby restaurants or you could fix a meal yourself or store your leftovers in the fridge. There's a Trader Joes nearby where you can buy inexpensive wine and all kinds of groceries for a reasonable cost. The staff was exceptionally friendly and very accommodating. The only issue we had was with one of the doormen when we first arrived. When we arrived and grabbed a brochure on an architectural river tour the doorman told us, "That one is sold out for tonight." He then tried to book us with a different company (I'm sure he gets a kickback or something). We ended up walking to the river and the tour with the original company was not sold out and he'd been lying to us. That was annoying, but I don't know if the doormen even work for the hotel. One suggestion I'd make if you stay here is to consider earplugs. We didn't hear noise from within the hotel, but from the street below. We were on the second to top floor and the sound of horns and cars did make it a little hard for me to fall asleep. That's probably not a hotel issue, just a city issue. My husband wasn't bothered by it, so maybe it's only an issue if you're sensitive to noise.A few tourist recommendations: check out Bobby's Bike Hike. We did the Chicago Neighborhood tour and it was definitely one of the highlights of the trip. You get to see things that are off the beaten path and the guide was a lot of fun and very informative. Definitely check out the fountains with the faces on them in Millenium Park. Lots of fun. Also, we went in both the Sears Tower and the Hancock Observatory and would recommend the Hancock. The views were of the water and the city and just prettier. The Sears Tower felt very sterile to me. It was hard to get a feel of how high up you are since it's completely closed off by windows that don't open. Having been in the Empire State Building and the Eiffel Tower there's something to be said for feeling the wind blowing on you and hearing the sounds below you. The Sears Tower doesn't give you that feeling. You can go up in the Hancock for free if you go to the Lounge and buy a drink. Two lousy mixed drinks were about $25 total so next time I'd just order a soda ($5.00) or pay to go to the actual observation deck. Don't miss the Field Museum. It's amazing. The Shedd Aquarium is also fun. If you've been to Sea World you won't be impressed by their live shows. Plus they seated everyone 1/2 hour before the show where you got to sit on a hard stone bench with someone's knees in your back and your knees in the back of the person in front of you. However, the exhibits were really well done. We saw a few things we've never seen before. Check out the City Pass as it saves you money if you'll be seeing a few of the major tourist attractions. Navy Pier was pretty disappointing to us. Several greasy chain restaurants and lots of ticky tacky tourist stuff. Maybe in the summer it's more fun with street performers and the like, but in late April it was a disappointment. Kids would enjoy it because of the ferris wheel, but don't go out of your way to see it. There's so many better things to see and do.Overall, great hotel, great city, just wished we could have stayed longer.

May 10 2008 	The right choose	Amazing location, Very close from the Hampton inn and the Hilton Garden Inn (downtown), so dont lose time, like i did, comparing locations, they are all great. You can have a 1 minute walk to the delicious, pricey, Joe's Stone Crab or a Sushi place with outstanding food quality and a forgettable name; if you walk to the other side you'll find P.F. Chang's. If you can walk more than a minute you will have numerous options.If working out is a must for you, as a homewood guest you can acces the "crunch" gym right next door. It's a really big place with lots of fine equipment, a paradise for the ones who need a gym. If you like running, it takes only a 2 minute jog to the track beside the lake where you can rent bikes or skates or just run. We walked to the stores, restaurants, theater (Jersey boys! a must!), Opera, Navy Pier, etc. If needed a taxi would cost 5-7 dollars.The room is nice, according to the price, with some details on the wallpaper and a small leak when rained (in a corner far away from the bed and sitting area, so we didnt mind) the room is not big but roomy and the view was perfetc!.Breakfast included is very good: fruit, kryspy kremes, eggs, cereals, breads, yoghur, etc.The staff at front desk are extremely corteous and helpful, they always gave us the best directions, tips and assistance. I will never go back to the other expensive hotels, this my hotel at Chicago from now on.

May 4 2008 	Our home in Chicago	We had a conference at the nearby Marriott and thankfully could not get a room there, since it would have been $3-400 a night there. We found Homewood Suites, which is literaly next door. From our room, we could look into the rooms at the Marriott.Boy are we glad we found this place. We paid $189 a night for 7 nights. If you stay 7 nights, it is considered "extended stay" and it is cheaper-probably cheaper total than if you stay 4-5 nights. Their pricing is a tad bit confusing because most room types have different rates on different nights, so just make sure you know what you average room rate is before thinking you got a great deal for all nights.Location: It is one block off Mag Mile, and across street from Nordstrom, PF Changs, Pizzeria Uno, Bloomingdales, ESPNzone etc. GREAT location within walking distance of anything on Michigan Ave. or the Loop. In the room they have menus from various eateries that will deliver. Rannallis is great for pretty basic italian fare and salads. They are fast and only charge $2.50 delivery. Public areas: The staff is very friendly. You take elevator to floor 6 for lobby, shop, and dining room.....Almost the best part is the breakfast, which is probably the best complimentary brekfasts I have had a hotel ever. Scrambled eggs, breakfast meat, panckaes, french toast or fresh waffles, cereal, donuts, bread bagels fruit, yogurt, juice hot drinks. It got a little monotonous after 7 days, but the higher end-hotels don't even have this nice a breakfast for $$. NOR do the ritzey places have a buffett dinner. It is Mon-Thursday and is basic, but they have themes. Spagetti and meatballs, hamburger, pizza, Philly Cheese steak, chinese, etc. Usually some steamed veggies, small salad bar, hot entree and usually some kind of vegetarian option like mac/cheese, potatoes. Beer and Wine and soft drinks. Cake and pudding for dessert. Very passable, especially if you think that yo are saving $40 on dinner or more. We ate there 2 night out of 7. You can take the food to-go up to your room as well.Room: we had a corner room. All the "_04" rooms are on the southeast corner which affords a view from the Hancock Tower to the Trump Tower and Wrigley Building in the middle. We loved it. You walk in and it has an almost full kitchen (no oven) with fridge, 2-burner cooktop, microwave, sink, dishwasher and dishes for about 4 people. Then there is a living area with dining table/desk, two dining chairs, an easy chair, couch, coffee table and tv. The bedroom has a confy king bed with pelty of pillows and clean duvet cover, tv and standard bathroom. You can close the bedroom door and the couch folds out. You have to go thru the bedroom to get to the bathroom. The dcor is urban, with warm colors and some ncie bw photos of Chicago architecture.There is free wireless and ethernet cable internet in the room, which worked great. They also have a business center on floor 6 with printers, and conference table etc, so you can print out boarding pass etc. All the expensive hotel charge $10 a dayand that is if you can get it to work properly. Overall, we were REALLY pleased with the quality AND value. These days you are lucky to get one of thsoe in a hotel, but to get both-wow, that says a lot. It makes you wonder how Hilton is able to do it, and makes you wonder how much profit these swankier palces make on just a simple room and no extras at all and still charge twice as much.We will be back to this place and will look for more of these Homewood Suites elsewhere.

Apr 7 2008	Good location and very nice	This hotel is very good in general.Good for families like us as rooms are spacious.Good value as breakfast and light dinner (Mon-Thurs) included.Location is great for the Magnificent mile.Main advise is not to trust the staff to help you with any transport. Staff at check-in (6th floor) are unware of information on getting around so refer you to the staff on the ground floor. I needed to get to another town, the staff booked me a terrible taxi with a man with a broken arm at an exhorbitant rate (I think he was related or something). The guy didn't know the route and didn't hang around for the return as previously agreed as he reckons he got an emergency call from the hospital who wanted to see him .... I didn't think hospitals were that responsive!!! I was told by the guy who sorted this out that limos would charge $300 each way. In the end I had to get a limo for the return which cost me $80 ... way cheaper than what the taxi driver charged me.This hotel is a great hotel but diminished by dodgy staff practices.

Apr 4 2008	homewood suites great for the family	Upon the the recommendations of TripAdvisor reviews we chose Homewood Suites on Grand Ave. one block from the Michigan Avenue for a two night stay the week after Easter. It cost $179 per night plus parking. We checked in an hour early and were given upon request a corner room on the top floor. The indoor pool was on the same floor. My wife and two daughters, ages 8 & 10 enjoyed the pool and the convenience of walking down the hall to go swimming. There is a free breakfast buffet and at 5:00 p.m., wine, beer and a light dinner during the week. The location was great and we had a 15 minute walk to the American Girl Store. The concierge/bellman, Rod, was very helpful and got as a discount for the river cruise which was also a short walk from the hotel. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Check out the Homewood Suites web cite for room details and prices..

Apr 3 2008 	Medical Conference	Was Here March 29 thru April 1.Pro's: [quite a lot]CleanFree wired and WiFi internet in roomsComfortable beds with plenty of pillowsBreakfast buffet : always with a meat servingCon's: [few and only mld]Only 2 elevators, but waits were not longI was very happy with my stay and will be back when business or pleasure opportunity presents.

Apr 1 2008 	Had a nice getaway	The Mrs and I decided to get out of Texas for a few days. We picked the Homewood because of location (Near just about everything). Staff very nice, very helpful. Mar 31 2008 	A surprising finding	We were attracted by the rates offerd by the website of this hotel and our stay exceeeded all expectations. All rooms have a spacious sitting area with a small but very useful kitchen and an adequate sized bedroom. The hotel also offers free wifi throughout.We found the hotel very convenient located for all shopping and main attractions of Chicago. Mar 25 2008 	Very Nice!	We stayed here March 21st and had a great experience. The rooms are very nice and clean and had a great view from the 18th floor. The breakfast buffet was great(according to my fiance...I wasn't hungry).The front desk staff is extremely friendly and the valet was great as well. The hotel is located within walking distance of most of the major shopping and only 7 blocks from Navy Pier. Mar 19 2008 	Wonderful Location Good Hotel!	The Homewood Suites in downtown Chicago is a fabulous place to stay -- a real deal given the rates the the superb location.The hotel is not fancy, but is perfectly adequate. Suites are quiet, nicely furnished and well equipped. Nice touches such as lots of soft, thirsty towels, flat screen TV, free internet elevate this hotel above much of the competition. Of course, each 'unit' is a suite! There is a full buffet breakfast served every morning -- nothing grand, but adequate (beware that it closes at 9:30 on weekdays); small pool and fitness area as well as access to a great Crunch gym next door. Staff were uniformly pleasant and accommodating -- a real bonus!!!Best of all is the location -- the Mag Mile is one block away, river north is full of wonderful restaurants for all budgets, you are within walking distance of the Loop attractions as well as subway station a few feet away! Good off-site parking is available next to the Hilton Garden Inn as well if you want to save a few dollars.For the price, with breakfast, room to spread out and fab location -- the Homewood Suites are wonderful! Enjoy!

Mar 16 2008 	wonderful hotel-great location.	We are checking out of Homewood Suites today. Great hotel! It is located where you can walk to everything. There are great restaurants all around the hotel. The breakfast buffet is awesomeand a full hot breakfast, There is a full kitchen and 2 separate rooms in the suite. The pool is indoor and heated on the 19th floor. The beds have great linens and there are plenty of thick towels provided. It is quiet and our room on the 17th floor has an incredible view. You can ask for a room with a view or high floor when you make your reservations. Very clean and spacious room. We will definitely stay here again!!! BTW-check out time of 12 noon is great for catching afternoon flights.

Feb 29 2008 	The staff make this a really good place to stay.	This could easily have been another anonymous box to stay in, but the staff make it really special. The hotel is in downtown Chicago, 5 minutes walk from the Michigan Avenue 'Magnificent Mile'. All rooms are suites, with a cooker, hob, pans and crockery. Breakfast is free, and there is a free evening meal on weekdays if you are on a budget (we didn't try it, but it looked OK - there seemed to be draft beer and carafes of wine). There is a gym and a pool. It's very child-friendly and would make a great hotel for families. We paid $140 plus tax's per night for an 8 day stay - this is very good for central Chicago. But its the staff who really make this hotel - very friendly and helpful - quite special.

Feb 19 2008 	First Chicago Trip	Homewood Suites Downtown is a good choice for the family traveler. The view of downtown buildings is great at night. The central location allows for walking to many stores and restaurants. At no time did we feel unsafe, although we were approached by many homeless folks, which can be said of many large cities. The rental car had GPS info, which was great for directions to the hotel, but was confused by all of the buildings when we went to leave (still found I-90 ok, had printed instructions just in case). Room service is available from PF Chang's, but there is a 20% surcharge imposed by the hotel and a delivery fee, neither of which are given to the delivery person. Breakfast each morning was excellent, with to go containers readily available to take back to the room. Staff was friendly. Pool was small, but exercise room was well equipped.

Feb 18 2008 	Great budget hotel.....with a few extras!	My wife and I just returned from a wonderful weekend in Chicago and the Homewood Suites was much more than I expected. Since we were on a budget we wanted to get as close to Michigan Avenue as we could without giving up too many frills. This hotel was a great value. They offer a full breakfast buffet every morning which will save you a few bucks especially if you have the kids with you. I will warn you that the buffet is quite crowded on the weekends so you may want to grab a takeout box and eat in your room. My wife and I traveled alone, but we were in the minority. Lots of kids running around so don't book this one for a Honeymoon or anything like that. The hotel is located directly across the street from Nordstroms which is the quickest (and warmest) way to access Michigan Avenue. Grand Avenue actually goes UNDER Michigan Avenue so if you are not aware of your surroundings you will walk right past it (Remember, go through Nordstroms). The room was clean and spacious and if you are staying for a long time they will even do some grocery shopping for you. Again, great for the budget conscious. The doormen are hilarious and will help you find anything you need. All in all, I would recommend this to anyone that is bringing the family to Chicago and wants to save a few bucks along the way. Enjoy!

Feb 12 2008 	Great Service in Chicago!	This was our second stay at the Homewood Suites in Chicago. Since last year they have updated the rooms with a flat screen TV, new flooring, and some updated appliances in the kitchen. What stood out the most was the consistent excellent customer service diplayed by the entire staff. We had a great stay and it's wel worth the money for it's location.

Feb 9 2008 	Good amenities spacious but Underwhelmed	I had a business trip to Chicago for 3 nights so I chose it for all the benefits it offers- free breakfast, free wireless, suite rooms. I paid $149/nite and while it was a good deal for the price I was not impressed with the rooms themselves. When I checked in around 10pm - the first room I got on the 8th floor which was supposed to be non-smoking was reeking of smoke. I didn't want to make a fuss but finally couldn't take it so called the front desk to either give me another room or have someone come with air freshener. The housekeeping came quickly with airfreshener and he agreed that the room smelled like someone smoked in it so they gave me a new room. The suites are a good size but a bit dark for my taste. Bathroom was stark and ceiling had water stains all over. Rug didn't look all that great /clean so felt like I had to have shoes on the whole time. I prefer hotels where I can kick off my shoes and just hang.. I'd stayed in a Homewood Suite before near Boston and thought it was fine but the Chicago one was a bit unimpressive. Overall I think if you were there with family - as it was for many guests it seems, it would be sufficient. Seemed like a great location, right next to PF Chang restaurant, Nordstrom, ESPN zone(?), overall pretty convenient. Again, the amenities are great - free full breakfast, free coffee/tea all day, free wireless access, etc. are all great. Bed is good, sofa is okay. Hardly used the kitchen but was pretty unhappy in the morning when I woke up to see they didn't restock my coffee... I have to say that I was underwhelmed - and didn't feel as comfy at Homewood as I did in Boston's Homewood. Personally, I wouldn't stay there again for personal or business reasons - not for me. I had plenty of hotel choices in Chicago for this biz trip and I kept kicking myself why I didn't choose the Embassy Suites nearby for $159/nite or stay closer to my office at the W - albeit for $209/nite... (albeit would have to pay for online access).. I've stayed in other Embassy Suites before and feel that their decor is usually more brighter/lighter and cleaner looking.

Feb 6 2008 	We had a great stay at Homewood!	My husband and I went to Chicago with our two young daughters for a quick overnight getaway. We live in Michigan and the train ride was about 3 hrs. Check-in was not until 4pm and we showed up around 3:45 hoping to get right in. The front desk attendant let us know it would be about a 15 minute wait which was reasonable considering actual check-in wasn't until 4pm anyway. She was very nice and during our wait she even updated us several times. The issue however was that it took more like 25 minutes, which was inconvenient given our daughters are 8 and 6 and had been waiting for this trip forever!Anyway, besides that one thing, everything else was great. When we got to our room it was immaculate. There was a fridge, microwave, coffee pot, hair dryer, etc. The couch pulled out to a sleeper bed. There were two double beds in the bedroom area. Everything was tastefully decorated. The bathroom was normal, but still very nice with plenty of towels and when we called for toothpaste it was brought right up. We went to the top floor pool and it was great. No one else was there and we had the pool all to ourselves. I wish they had a hot tub but no biggie. The breakfast buffet was amazing. They had pretty much anything you wanted from eggs, hash, and french toast to fresh fruit, donuts and bagels. The drinks were juices, milks (chocolate or white and even skim), coffee, hot tea, hot chocolate or pop. And it was all free and all delicious. The kids thought this was paradise. Check-out was a breeze. I forgot to mention there were plenty of pillows on the beds and a super soft blanket. We slept great. Everything was quiet, there was plenty of hot water. I honestly can't think of anything bad to say about the place. It was great for the four of us and for $140 two blocks from Michigan Ave, I would definitely stay there again.

Feb 3 2008 	Definitely coming back!	This was my first time in the city, but my husband has traveled here before. I was expecting the normal city attitude....rush, rush, with not the cleanist atmosphere but acceptable for a big city.....however I was very pleasantly surprised! The hotel was amazing, for the rate we paid we werent expecting to be so satisfied. The staff was super welcoming and friendly, from the personalized welcome message left on our room machine after check in, to the fresh hot breakfast and super friendly staff. Always greeting you and willing to help with anything. Whether its just holding the door and wishing you a good evening as you venture out for dinner or giving you a run down of the "must see" locations during your visit. And if you need a cab, don't worry...The door men go out of thier way to hail a cab and provide some entertainment as you wait! I would have thought we paid much more. This hotel does not take any short cuts. Rooms were spatious, clean, and provided a warm atmosphere with an outstanding view! I will deffinetly book a room at this hotel for my next visit to the windy city!

Jan 21 2008 	Great place to stay in Chicago!	I had a wonderful experience at Homewood Suites. The hotel is in great location...right next to Michigan Ave and less than two blocks from a Red line stop which made it easy for me to get around Chicago. Upon arrival, I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. I was impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and the amenities that they offered. I plan to stay there again on my next trip to Chicago.

Jan 14 2008 	Great Hotel	stayed at this homewood for 9 nights, made my choice after reading the reviews and I wasn't disappointed at allthis hotel has many many qualities:location, 5 minutes from Michigan Ave,rates, we booked on hilton.com and paid $150/night,big rooms, well furnished, great bed,an awesome breakfast (I was excepting the usual buffet) the choice is just incredible,a welcome home buffet with drinks and (again) a great choice of food,and the hotel staff, everyone was very nicewill stay there again

Jan 10 2008 	Best Hotel I've stayed in by far	I am just back from staying in the Homewood Suites Chicago. Myself and 3 others stayed there for a week over the New Year. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough. From its location to it facilities we could not have asked for more. It is located only a 3/4 min walk form Mag Mile (where all the shops are), there is a Nordstrom right across the road, plus there are loads of bars and restaurants all within 5 min walking distance of the hotel. The complimentary breakfast was ideal to set you up for the day with all tastes being catered for, all the "light meal" they provide on mon-thurs (also complimentary) is just enough when you want to unwind after a long days shopping/sightseeing. The hotel also has free internet access which was a real help when we wanted to look something in particaular up.The rooms were fantastic, the most comfortable beds i've slept in in ages, the seperated living room and bedroom were ideal when there was a dispute over the telly or one person wanted to sleep.The staff at the hotel were brilliant, especially the lads at the conceigerge, they couldn't have been more helpful, no matter how trivial your question.All in all we had a fantastic time in chicago, and we will definitely being staying in Homewood suites the next time we go. I have friends already planning on staying there when they visit during the year.

Jan 8 2008 	Our family loved the Homewood Suites!	Our family of six stayed at the Homewood Suites January 2-4, 2008, and it was the perfect choice! This is an all-suite hotel, and each suite has a full kitchen (including garbage disposal, range top, and dishwasher!). The bedroom is a separate room, so it was great to be able to put the kids down for the night and enjoy watching movies with my husband until we were ready to go to bed. A suite with two double beds (which is what we had) sleeps six very comfortably...especially since both rooms have a TV, which meant that I wasn't stuck watching Cartoon Network 24/7. :-)The breakfast was just wonderful! It had all the usual complimentary continental breakfast fare, plus fresh fruit, granola, and yogurt to make your own parfaits...plus a great variety of hot items! This is a great, hot breakfast, which we particularly enjoyed since the weather was so horrifyingly cold while we were in Chicago.We didn't avail ourselves of the complimentary evening meal, so I can't speak with any authority on it...but based on everything else we saw, I'm sure it was very good also.Since we had kids with us, though, I CAN speak with absolute authority on the pool, which is located on the top floor of the hotel and which has the most beautiful view of the city in three directions! It was particularly stunning after dark! Even if you don't plan to swim, it's worth the elevator ride to check out the view.Finally, the location was absolutely ideal! The Homewood Suites is less than two blocks from Michigan Avenue (and its easy bus access) and less than two blocks from a red line subway station. And there is a Jewel/Osco just two blocks away...perfect for picking up CTA passes, snacks, and groceries.The Homewood Suites isn't a fancy-schmancy hotel like the Four Seasons or the Peninsula, but there is a good reason why TripAdvisor members have ranked it the best hotel in Chicago for families: it is the PERFECT hotel in the downtown area for families with kids!

Dec 31 2007 	Excellent deal. Perfect choice for visiting Chicago.	My wife and I stayed 3 nights at the Homewood Suites Chicago Downtown and I can tell you that we were absolutely satisfied with the Hotel:- The room was huge, with a complete kitchen, a living room with a great flat TV and a separate dormitory with another big flat TV. You can even take food to your room with a Tupperware (that you find in the buffet)!!!.- The staff was really nice and always ready to help you.- The location is perfect, in the city center within a four minutes walking to the magnificent mile, and next to the famous Uno's legendary Chicago Style Deep Dish Pizza!What else can we ask for? Homewood Suites Chicago is a perfect choice!

Dec 31 2007	absolutely...wonderful	i was in chicago from september 17-22 for a convention.. my company booked this hotel for me. the hotel is centrally located , michican ave is less than a block away. perfect location! the suites are huge with comfy beds and a beautiful kitchenette. breakfast is the best... bountiful.. not just muffins and toast... i mean everything you can imagine...waffles, bacon, sausage , hash browns, toast, danishes, omelets, burritos, all freshly made... not artifical... really good. and clean .. also they have a free dinner... buffet.. excellent... mexican night, chinese night, american fare.. all included.. wine and beer also.. well worth the expensive price of $279 a night. a very classy and clean hotel.. i love chicago... will come again!
